snippet: The lobbying group for seniors reported an overall rise in the cost of drugs in recent years despite a decrease in the price of generic drugs.
abstract: Report issued by AARP shows that prices of drugs used most widely by seniors rose by nearly 26 percent from 2005 to 2009; increase occurred even as the price of generic drugs, which account for the majority of prescriptions, has been falling; pharmaceutical industry criticizes report, saying expanded availability of generic drugs has slowed price increases and that the report is flawed.
lead_paragraph: The lobbying group for seniors reported an overall rise in the cost of drugs in recent years despite a decrease in the price of generic drugs.

headline.seo: AARP Study Says Price of Popular Drugs Rose 26%
headline.main: AARP Study Says Price of Popular Drugs Rose 26%
headline.print_headline: AARP Study Says Price of Popular Drugs Rose 26%
